events.title: Security Council LIVE: UN raises alarm over deadly Iran protests and ‘possible military strikes’
events.description: The UN Security Council is meeting in New York in emergency session on Iran, amid escalating concern over reports that hundreds have been killed during weeks of nationwide anti-government protests. The meeting was requested by the United States. Demonstrations that began in late December, fuelled by soaring inflation, rising food prices and the collapse of the national currency, triggered a deadly and widespread crackdown with thousands injured and detained, according to numerous firsthand accounts. The UN has called for independent investigations into all killings and warned against the possible use of the death penalty against protesters. Follow live coverage below, and UN News app users can go here.

events.title: UN chief warns of a world in chaos as impunity and unpredictability spreads
events.description: In his final annual address outlining his priorities, UN Secretary-General António Guterres warned that the world is “brimming with conflict, impunity, inequality and unpredictability” – even as international cooperation is fraying at the moment it is most needed.

events.title: 'Experienced terrorist' with links to deadly ambush killed by US strike
events.description: An "experienced terrorist leader" with ties to al Qaeda has been killed in US strikes, after an Islamic State ambush last month left three Americans dead.

events.title: Will AI kickstart a new age of nuclear power?
events.description: The rapidly expanding use of artificial intelligence worldwide is putting electrical grids under huge pressure and many believe that, to meet that need without contributing to the climate crisis, a full-scale expansion of nuclear energy is essential.

events.title: Police warn of ‘door-kicking challenge’ that can turn viral prank ‘from funny to fatal’
events.description: Authorities issued a warning as a door-kicking prank trend gains traction on social media. The dangerous challenge has led to shootings and arrests nationwide.

events.title: Former Iranian prisoners reveal torture horrors as regime kills protesters on sight during crackdown
events.description: Three former political prisoners in Iran share harrowing accounts of detention abuse, warning the world about escalating violence during the current uprising.

events.title: At least 32 killed as crane collapses on train in Thailand
events.description: Crane in use on high-speed rail project hits passing train, causing it to derail At least 32 people in Thailand have been killed and scores injured after a crane collapsed on to a passenger train and derailed it, officials said. Footage from the scene verified by Agence France-Presse showed the crane’s broken structure resting on giant concrete pillars and smoke rising from the wreckage of the train below. Continue reading...

events.title: More than 100 people die as torrential rain and flooding hit three countries
events.description: More than 100 people have been killed after torrential rain caused flooding across South Africa, Mozambique and Zimbabwe, with authorities issuing warnings that more severe weather is expected across several countries in southern Africa.

events.title: US strike eliminates al Qaeda operative connected to ISIS ambush that killed 3 Americans in Syria
events.description: U.S. forces killed an al Qaeda-affiliated leader allegedly linked to an ISIS attack that killed three Americans in Syria, as CENTCOM launched counterterrorism operations Jan. 16.

events.title: ‘Disappointed’ Jewish leaders call for compromise on hate speech laws after Labor backs down on bill
events.description: Executive Council of Australia Jewry implores Anthony Albanese and Sussan Ley to thrash out deal after government splits contentious bill Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Jewish leaders have warned Labor and the Coalition their community remains at risk from the promotion of antisemitic hatred, urging a last-minute compromise to secure tough new hate speech laws ahead of a special sitting of parliament. After Anthony Albanese agreed to split draft laws made in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack, new gun control measures, immigration powers and a scheme to designate extremist organisations are set to pass with the support of the Greens. Continue reading...

events.title: UNRWA officials lobby congressional staffers against Trump terrorist designation threat
events.description: UNRWA officials briefed congressional staffers on potential Trump administration plans to designate the U.N. agency as a terrorist organization.

events.title: Pentagon readies 1,500 troops as Minnesota protests grow
events.description: The Pentagon has ordered 1,500 soldiers to prepare for a possible deployment to Minnesota after protests erupted following the fatal shooting of Renee Good by an ICE agent, with President Trump threatening to invoke the Insurrection Act.

events.title: Amid Sudan’s humanitarian crisis, Chad shows ‘act of solidarity’
events.description: In war-torn Sudan, local communities say they don’t have enough settlements for the internally displaced, few solutions for women who have suffered sexual violence – and there’s a lack of aid available for people with disabilities.

events.title: WFP warns Sudan food aid could run out in March
events.description: The World Food Programme (WFP) said on Thursday that it is struggling to keep emergency operations running in Sudan, where more than 1,000 days of war have pushed families to the brink.

events.title: Federal judge restricts ICE agents amid ongoing Minneapolis area protests
events.description: U.S. District Judge Kate Menendez, in Minnesota, bars ICE and Border Patrol from using tear gas against peaceful protesters during Operation Metro Surge in Minneapolis following deadly shooting of Renee Good.

events.title: Top Iran prayer leader who dubbed protesters 'Trump's soldiers' calls for executions amid ongoing unrest
events.description: Iranian cleric reportedly calls for death penalty against protesters as regime claims widespread damage to mosques and hospitals during nationwide unrest.

events.title: Myanmar begins defence in landmark genocide case at UN World Court
events.description: Myanmar on Friday rejected allegations of genocide against the Rohingya minority, telling the International Court of Justice (ICJ) that the Gambia’s case rests on “unsubstantiated allegations,” as public hearings continued in a landmark case on the application of the Genocide Convention.

events.title: Ohio dentist slayings suspect indicted on more aggravated murder, burglary charges
events.description: Michael McKee indicted on murder charges in fatal shootings of dentist Spencer Tepe and wife Monique in Columbus, Ohio, domestic violence case.

events.title: Game-changing international ocean treaty comes into force
events.description: Almost two decades in the making, an international agreement to protect and sustainably use marine life in international waters and the international seabed is due to come into force on Saturday, marking a major step forward in efforts to ensure the health of ocean ecosystems for decades to come.

events.title: Iran: UN urges ‘maximum restraint’ to avert more death, wider escalation
events.description: As nationwide protests in Iran appear to ease after nearly three weeks of unrest and bloodshed, a senior UN official called on Thursday for action to prevent further escalation.

events.title: Iran’s supreme leader acknowledges thousands killed as Trump calls for new leadership: reports
events.description: Iran's supreme leader Khamenei reportedly acknowledges thousands died in recent protests for the first time, as death toll estimates reach over 3,000.

events.title: Trump’s ‘board of peace’ appears to seek wider mandate beyond Gaza
events.description: While launched as part of Gaza ceasefire, Trump envisions board as 'bold new approach to resolving global conflicts'.

events.title: Rapper suggests foreign forces brought in for 'massacre' crackdown in Iran
events.description: An Iranian rapper who took part in the country's protests has described "a massacre on the streets", suggesting foreign forces have been brought in to stamp out the demonstrations.

events.title: Iran supreme leader acknowledges thousands killed during recent protests
events.description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei says some deaths were “inhuman” and “savage” but blames the US.

events.title: US says it killed al-Qaeda-affiliated leader tied to deadly Syria ambush
events.description: CENTCOM says strike in northwest Syria on Friday killed a man tied to the December attack that killed US troops.

events.title: Iran: Khamenei holds Trump 'guilty' for deaths in protests
events.description: Iran's supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, blamed US President Donald Trump for the casualties that occurred during the recent protests in Iran. Follow DW for the latest.

events.title: At least three people killed after huge shopping centre fire in Pakistan
events.description: A fire at a shopping centre in Pakistan has killed at least three people and injured several others.

events.title: Indonesian rescuers find plane wreckage in mountainous region
events.description: Indonesian rescuers have recovered wreckage from a missing plane believed to have crashed with 11 people on board

events.title: Pakistan road crashes kill at least 24 people and injure 45 others
events.description: Authorities in Pakistan say at least two dozen people have been killed and 45 others injured in separate road crashes hours apart

events.title: Gaza humanitarian crisis ‘far from being over,’ UN aid coordination office warns
events.description: Three months into the ceasefire in the Gaza Strip, the UN and partners have delivered tonnes of assistance items and carried out critical repairs, but this is only a temporary “Band-Aid” solution, a veteran aid worker has warned.

events.title: WATCH: Ellen Greenberg’s ex-fiancé dodges questions as feds reopen death case of teacher with 23 stab wounds
events.description: Federal authorities reportedly reopen investigation into Ellen Greenberg's controversial 2011 death as former fiancé Sam Goldberg spotted in NYC.

events.title: Uganda’s opposition leader ‘taken by army’ as Museveni nears re-election
events.description: Bobi Wine flown to unknown location, his party says, hours after security forces allegedly killed 10 of his campaigners The Ugandan opposition leader Bobi Wine was taken from his house and brought to an unknown location on Friday, his party said as President Yoweri Museveni closed in on a landslide re-election. Wine’s National Unity Platform party said on Friday evening in a post on X that an army helicopter had landed in his compound in the capital, Kampala, and “forcibly taken him away to an unknown destination”. Continue reading...

events.title: EU and Mercosur bloc sign landmark free trade deal after 25 years of negotiations
events.description: The European Union and the Mercosur bloc of South American countries signed on Saturday signed a free trade deal that follows a quarter-century of careful negotiations. France still remains opposed to the trade agreement, with the country's powerful agricultural lobby warning it could damage local farmers' livelihoods.

events.title: A Saudi-UAE rift is turning two close allies into regional rivals
events.description: The key question now is whether the Saudi-UAE rift settles back into business as usual or accelerates into a wider realignment, says Marc Lynch, professor of political science and international affairs at George Washington University.

events.title: Man allegedly assaulted with flagpole by Minneapolis anti-ICE agitators in violent parking garage attack
events.description: Jake Lang, a pardoned Jan. 6 rioter, was also allegedly attacked during anti-ICE protests, Saturday, outside Minneapolis City Hall.

events.title: Family of Iranian protester searched for her body in a pile of corpses and buried her on a roadside
events.description: The family of a 23-year-old Iranian college student believes she was killed by a bullet fired by Iranian security forces

events.title: Secretary-General on UN at 80: Humanity strongest when we stand as one
events.description: Powerful forces are lining up to undermine global cooperation, United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres warned at a landmark event in London on Saturday to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the General Assembly, but he urged that “humanity is strongest when we stand as one”.

events.title: World News in Brief: Gaza education update, the General Assembly at 80, Venezuela’s humanitarian needs
events.description: More children in war-ravaged Gaza are now back in the classroom, the UN aid coordination office (OCHA) said on Friday.

events.title: 11-year streak of record global warming continues, UN weather agency warns
events.description: The past 11 years have been the warmest in the modern era, while oceans continue to heat up, too, says the UN weather agency.

events.title: A deadly fire swept through a nightclub in just 90 seconds. I got out
events.description: Twenty-two years before the Swiss ski resort fire, Gina escaped a near-identical disaster. Would you know what to do if it happened to you?

events.title: US launches new retaliatory strike in Syria, killing leader tied to deadly Islamic State ambush
events.description: A third round of retaliatory strikes by the U.S. in Syria has resulted in the death of an Al-Qaeda-affiliated leader, said U.S. Central Command.

events.title: US takeover of Greenland could mean ‘end of NATO as we know it’, expert warns
events.description: Large crowds gathered in Copenhagen to protest US President Donald Trump’s push to take over Greenland, an autonomous Danish territory. As both Denmark and the United States are members of the NATO alliance, any US aggression against another member state raises profound questions about the bloc’s future. If the United States were to invade Greenland, “this would essentially mean the end of NATO as we know it,” said Guntram Wolff, a senior fellow at Bruegel.

events.title: 5 skiers killed in a pair of avalanches in Austria
events.description: Rescue helicopters, mountain rescue and Red Cross dog teams rushed to the scene.

events.title: Aid cuts push millions in West and Central Africa deeper into hunger
events.description: A staggering 55 million people across West and Central Africa are expected to suffer crisis levels of hunger, or worse, during the lean season from June to August as funding cuts to humanitarian operations continue amid rising violence and displacement.

events.title: In Gaza, 800,000 people now live in dangerous locations prone to flooding
events.description: Fighting the harsh winter storms in Gaza, Amina stays awake at night, hitting the canvas of the tent above her head to prevent it from collapsing under the pooled water.

events.title: Myanmar’s Rohingya people called ‘Muslim dogs’ before attacks, ICJ hears
events.description: Hearings continued on Thursday at the UN’s top court into the Gambia’s claim that Myanmar committed genocide against the Rohingya people, with allegations that military officials incited violence through hate speech, calling the ethnic minority “Muslim dogs” who should be made “extinct”.

events.title: Yemen’s fragile calm unravels as hunger and aid restrictions deepen crisis
events.description: A fragile political calm in Yemen is fraying, with renewed instability and aid restrictions deepening hunger, illness and displacement for millions of civilians, senior UN officials warned the Security Council on Wednesday.

events.title: Secret Service aware after Iranian state TV airs Trump threat featuring photo of Butler assassination attempt
events.description: Iranian state TV allegedly aired threatening message against Trump, referencing his Butler assassination attempt with caption "this time, it won't miss."

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: South Korean prosecutors demand death penalty for former president Yoon Suk Yeol
events.description: Yoon is on trial for insurrection charges, after trying to declare martial law in late 2024 South Korean prosecutors have demanded the death penalty for former president Yoon Suk Yeol over his failed martial law declaration in December 2024, in the first insurrection trial of a Korean head of state in three decades. Prosecutors characterised the case as the “serious destruction of constitutional order by anti-state forces”, telling Seoul central district court that Yoon had “directly and fundamentally infringed upon the safety of the state and the survival and freedom of the people”. Continue reading...

events.title: East Jerusalem: Forced shutdown of UN clinic signals escalating disregard for international law
events.description: The temporary closure of a UN-run health centre in East Jerusalem is the latest phase in “a pattern of deliberate disregard” for international law, the head of the UN agency that assists Palestine refugees, UNRWA, said on Wednesday.

events.title: Khamenei calls Trump a ‘criminal,’ blames him for deadly protests sweeping Iran
events.description: Iran's supreme leader accused President Donald Trump of orchestrating protests as tensions escalate. State radio broadcasts threats as thousands reported dead.

events.title: FAA warns about flying in Central, South America and eastern Pacific, citing possible ‘military activities’
events.description: The FAA issued a series of flight safety warnings for U.S. airlines flying over the eastern Pacific near Mexico, Central America and South America

events.title: Exiled Iranian crown prince reveals 6-step plan to exert pressure on Tehran's regime
events.description: Exiled Iranian crown prince Reza Pahlavi outlined his 6-step plan to exert international pressure on the regime, describing it as being "close to collapse"

events.title: Trump’s push to acquire Greenland sparks international media frenzy on remote island
events.description: A surge of international media has descended on Greenland as President Trump renews his push to acquire the strategic Arctic island.

events.title: Under fire from the sea, families in Odesa try to escape Russian barrage
events.description: Ukraine's third largest city has come under sustained attack on its ports in a Russian bid to sap morale.

events.title: Rare twins born in DRC raise cautious hope for endangered mountain gorillas
events.description: Virunga park ranger says babies are well cared for by mother Mafuko but high infant mortality makes first weeks critical It was noon by the time Jacques Katutu first saw the newborn mountain gorillas. Cradled in the arms of their mother, Mafuko, the tiny twins clung to her body for warmth in the forest clearing in Virunga national park, in eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC). Katutu, head of gorilla monitoring in Virunga, has seen dozens of newborns in his 15 years as a ranger. But, he tells the Guardian, even he was touched by the sight of the fragile infant males, who face serious obstacles if they are to become silverbacks one day. Continue reading...

events.title: Syrian army advances in north amid Kurdish clashes, US kills al Qaeda-affiliated leader
events.description: Syrian government forces on Sunday advanced into several areas of northern Syria previously held by Kurdish-led fighters after talks on integrating their forces stalled, amid calls for de-escalation. The US reported a strike in northwest Syria targeting an al Qaeda-affiliated leader officials say had a direct tie to the Islamic State member responsible for last month’s deadly ambush.

events.title: Big names on Trump's peace panel face huge challenges in Gaza
events.description: Whatever the concerns and complexities, it remains the only plan in town, with many world leaders pledging to support it, writes John Sudworth.

events.title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei blames Trump for deadly protests
events.description: Iran’s supreme leader has accused US President Donald Trump of being behind the deaths of ‘several thousand’ protesters.

events.title: Iran's supreme leader acknowledges thousands killed as pressure builds on clerical rule
events.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei acknowledged that "thousands" have been killed in protests that began in late December. But he put the blame on President Trump.

events.title: How dangerous are Iranian secret services in Germany?
events.description: Iranians in exile are being targeted by the regime's secret services, which is believed to be responsible for thousands of deaths since the start of the mass protests in Iran.

events.title: Iran's Khamenei calls for crackdown on 'seditionists' after brutally repressing protests
events.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei called for "domestic criminals" to face swift punishment, accusing "seditionists" of being responsible for the death of thousands of people during the recent protest wave. Rights groups have put the death toll of the government's crackdown in the thousands.

events.title: Hundreds rally in Paris against Iran’s crackdown on protesters
events.description: Hundreds gathered Saturday outside of the Pantheon in the heart of the French capital to voice their opposition to the Iranian regime and its violent crackdown on protesters, FRANCE 24's Clovis Casali said, reporting from Paris.

events.title: Iran's leader calls Trump a 'criminal' for backing protests
events.description: He blamed demonstrators for causing thousands of deaths.

events.title: Peacekeeping: Lacroix warns of rising threats to ‘blue helmets’ in Middle East
events.description: Peacekeeping operations in the Middle East are facing mounting security risks, funding pressures and political uncertainty, the head of UN peacekeeping warned on Friday.

events.title: Tyler Robinson's lover Lance Twiggs no longer protected by FBI: What we know about alleged assassin's partner
events.description: FBI ends protection for transgender partner of Charlie Kirk's alleged assassin Tyler Robinson after four months of ongoing investigation into the shooting.

events.title: Indonesian rescuers find wreckage of plane that had 11 people on board
events.description: A helicopter has spotted what appears to be a small aircraft window in a forested area on a slope of Mount Bulusaraung.

events.title: EU, Mercosur bloc sign free trade deal after 25 years of negotiations
events.description: European and South American leaders say pact sends 'clear signal' amid concerns over global tariffs, isolationism.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: A regional passenger aircraft with 11 people is missing in Indonesia and a search is underway
events.description: A regional passenger aircraft carrying 11 people has lost contact with ground control while approaching a mountainous region between Java and Sulawesi islands in Indonesia

events.title: Ukrainian delegation arrives in US for peace talks as Russia hammers energy sites
events.description: A Ukrainian delegation has arrived in the United States for talks on a U.S.-led diplomatic push to end the nearly 4-year-old war

events.title: The UN is ‘worth fighting for’: General Assembly President
events.description: With the multilateral system under pressure and under attack, Member States must fight for the United Nations, the President of the General Assembly said on Wednesday, laying out her priorities for its resumed 80th session.

events.title: A protester from Iran shares her experience
events.description: NPR's Scott Simon speaks with A., an Iranian who recently left the country after participating in several days of protests.

events.title: French President Emmanuel Macron discusses Greenland and Iran during emergency defense council meeting
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron held an emergency defense council meeting at the Élysée Palace on Thursday to discuss Greenland and Iran - among other issues. He then visited a military base in the south of France. In his speech to the troops, Macron highlighted the tense geopolitical situation and announced an increase to the French army budget.

events.title: Minnesota National Guard placed on standby to support law enforcement as protests turn violent
events.description: Minnesota National Guard members will wear yellow reflective vests to distinguish themselves from other law enforcement if activated during anti-ICE protests.

events.title: 911 transcripts, documents detail chaotic scene after ICE agent fatally shot Renee Good
events.description: Renee Nicole Good suffered four gunshot wounds, according to newly released reports. Witnesses described the chaotic scene and said she was shot at 'point-blank' range.

events.title: ICE releases photos after violent Minneapolis protests leave multiple alleged agitators arrested
events.description: ICE released photos of four alleged agitators arrested on federal charges during Minneapolis protests outside the Bishop Henry Whipple Federal Building Thursday.

events.title: Trump announces escalating tariffs on Denmark and other European nations to force Greenland purchase deal
events.description: President Donald Trump threatens steep tariffs on European nations unless Denmark sells Greenland to the U.S., citing national defense and security.

events.title: I want to show the world what Africa is - YouTube star brings joy and tears on tour
events.description: "I love the love in Africa. The energy here is crazy," he says on his maiden tour of the continent.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Canada PM hails strategic partnership with China to adapt to ‘new global realities’
events.description: Mark Carney holds talks with Xi Jinping on rare Beijing trip as Canada seeks to diversify trade links away from US Business live – latest updates Canada’s prime minister, Mark Carney, has hailed a “new strategic partnership” with China as he held talks in Beijing with President Xi Jinping , the first visit by a Canadian leader in eight years. Addressing Xi in the Great Hall of the People, Carney said: “Together we can build on the best of what this relationship has been in the past to create a new one adapted to new global realities.” Continue reading...

events.title: Will Turkey export home-grown 'Islamic State' extremists?
events.description: Turkey is no longer just a transit country for one branch of the extremist "Islamic State" group. Experts say the group has become more professional in Turkey and could pose a danger domestically, and abroad.

events.title: EU and Mercosur countries sign landmark free trade deal
events.description: The agreement took 25 years to negotiate and will create one of the world's largest free trade zones. The deal was signed, despite opposition from some European farmers.

events.title: Syrian troops clash with Kurdish forces as both sides trade blame for breaking withdrawal deal
events.description: At least four Syrian soldiers and an unknown number of Kurdish-led troops have been killed in clashes that broke out during the agreed withdrawal of Kurdish fighters across the Euphrates River. The Syrian army says it has now entered the city of Taqba on the river's west bank, which the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces say they had not agreed to leave.

events.title: 'Greenland fiasco: Vladimir Putin happiest person in the world' - Lt. General (ret.) Ben Hodges
events.description: In a wide‑ranging interview with Gavin Lee, Lt. General (ret.) Ben Hodges, former commander of U.S. Army Europe and NATO Allied Land Command, offers a candid assessment of the current geopolitical landscape: Ukraine, NATO, U.S. foreign policy and Trump's quest "to dominate the entire Western Hemisphere." Hodges argues "Greenland is not about security, just like Venezuela was not about drugs." Drawing on decades of military service, Hodges highlights deep structural risks to Western alliances, and reframes contemporary flashpoints as interconnected strategic challenges.

events.title: French firms in Brazil eye gains from EU-Mercosur trade deal
events.description: French businesses in Brazil are looking to benefit from the newly inked EU-Mercosur deal which Brazil's President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva and EU chief Ursula von der Leyen on Friday hailed as a victory for multilateralism at a time of global volatility. France is the second largest foreign investor in Brazil, but only its 14th biggest trading partner, a paradox the trade agreement could correct.

events.title: Protests explode in Greenland amid Trump takeover push: 'We are not interested in being Americans'
events.description: Thousands marched in Greenland wearing "Make America Go Away" hats, rejecting Trump's purchase demands and tariff threats saying, "We are not interested in being Americans."

events.title: Lindsey Graham speaks against pending execution of 26-year-old Iranian protester: 'This regime must fall'
events.description: Sen. Lindsey Graham calls for Iranian regime change as 26-year-old protester Erfan Soltani faces possible execution despite President Donald Trump's threats.

events.title: Gangland killing at a funeral shocks idyllic French island
events.description: Corsica is shaken by the shooting, which brings into stark relief one of the highest murder rates in France.

events.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,424
events.description: These are the key developments from day 1,424 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

events.title: Zelenskyy demands faster energy imports as Ukraine reels from power outages
events.description: Russian attacks on Ukraine's energy infrastructure leave thousands without power in freezing winter temperatures.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Yoweri Museveni wins Ugandan election as opponent condemns ‘fake result’
events.description: Museveni’s opponent, Bobi Wine, alleges that members of polling staff were kidnapped and called for peaceful protests Yoweri Museveni, has won the Ugandan election and his seventh term with more than 70% of the vote, state election authorities have said, amid an internet shutdown and claims of fraud by his opponent. His opponent, a youthful musician known as Bobi Wine, condemned what he called “fake results” and alleged that members of polling staff were kidnapped, among other election irregularities. He called for peaceful protests to pressure the authorities to release what he called the “rightful results”. Continue reading...

events.title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro finds novel way to reduce 27-year sentence: reading books
events.description: Former president convicted for coup plot to take advantage of law that knocks four days off jail term for each book read Jair Bolsonaro’s lawyers appear to have been reading up on the country’s penal code and have found a way to help their client reduce the 27-year prison sentence he received last year for plotting a coup: by reading books. There is only one problem: the former far-right Brazilian president has never been known as a bibliophile. “Sorry, I don’t have time to read,” Bolsonaro once declared. “It’s been three years since I read a book.” Continue reading...

events.title: South Korea sentences ex-president to five years in first martial law verdict
events.description: Yoon Suk Yeol’s conviction for obstructing own arrest separate from main trial that could lead to death penalty A South Korean court has sentenced former president Yoon Suk Yeol to five years in prison for mobilising presidential security forces to block his own arrest and abusing his powers. It is the first judicial ruling linked to the events surrounding his failed martial law declaration in December 2024. The ruling is separate from Yoon’s main insurrection trial, where prosecutors earlier this week sought the death penalty and a verdict is due next month. Continue reading...

events.title: Shark attack at Nielsen Park in Sydney’s east leaves boy fighting for his life
events.description: Child in a critical condition in hospital after being pulled from the water in Vaucluse at about 4.20pm Sunday Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A boy has been attacked by a shark in Sydney’s east and is in a critical condition after suffering serious injuries to both legs. The boy, believed to be aged about 12, was pulled from the water at Shark beach at Neilsen Park, in the eastern suburb of Vaucluse, on Sunday afternoon. Continue reading...

events.title: Uganda's longtime leader declared winner in disputed vote
events.description: Museveni claims victory in Uganda's contested election as opposition leader Bobi Wine goes into hiding amid chaos, violence and accusations of fraud.

events.title: Israel objects to US lineup of 'Gaza executive board'
events.description: Netanyahu's office said the lineup runs contrary to Israeli policy. The Trump administration had announced panel members who will oversee the transitional government in the war-ravaged Palestinian territory.

events.title: How European cinema is stealing Hollywood's spotlight
events.description: As Hollywood doubles down on sequels, the contenders for the European Film Awards feature bold, political works that are challenging audiences and creating buzz far beyond the continent.

events.title: Trump's erratic trade policies are pushing US partners towards China
events.description: Key US trade partners are responding to President Donald Trump’s often belligerent and unpredictable policies by looking to take their business elsewhere. Canada's decision on Friday to cut tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles is the latest example of how Trump's erratic trade policies are pushing allies into the arms of America's greatest economic rival.

events.title: ‘Playing straight into Russia’s hands’: Expert warns Trump’s Greenland push strains NATO
events.description: President Donald Trump’s pursuit of Greenland is creating a rift between the US and other NATO allies, fracturing the alliance and “playing straight into Russia’s hands,” said Jean-François Bélanger, assistant professor at the Institute for Military Operations at the Royal Danish Defence College.

events.title: Journalists in Bangladesh demand protection amid rising attacks
events.description: Journalists and media leaders in Bangladesh are demanding protection after recent attacks on two major newspapers

events.title: Ugandan police deny arrest of opposition leader as country awaits final election results
events.description: Police in Uganda have denied reports that the main opposition candidate in Thursday’s tense election had been arrested

events.title: One of Tyler Robinson's last meals as a free man may have been a steak dinner — medium rare
events.description: Tyler Robinson's potential last meal as a free man was traced to a Utah steakhouse before the Charlie Kirk shooting arrest, a restaurant owner told FBI investigators.

events.title: Trump launches phase 2 of Gaza peace plan — but Hamas disarmament remains the real test
events.description: Trump launches phase two of Gaza plan focusing on demilitarization Hamas and reconstruction, but experts warn disarming Hamas remains decisive challenge.

events.title: Protesters pledge to ‘break the ban’ on 26 January after standoff at Sydney rally – as it happened
events.description: This blog is now closed. Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Labor does not ‘share the concerns of the Greens’ on hate speech laws: Gallagher Speaking at Parliament House in Canberra, the finance minister, Katy Gallagher , says she has spoken with the Coalition and the Greens Senate managers ahead of this week’s special sittings. We don’t share the concerns of the Greens on that one, and we’ve made that clear to them in the last week. The elements of the bill that exist without the racial vilification still have very strong purpose around combating antisemitism, and that is why many of these groups, including neo-Nazis, have foreshadowed they are going disband, once they saw this exposure draft bill. The PM has been clear about this from the get go, that we need to get something from the opposition. We haven’t had anything to date, and we need to make sure that the parliament does deal with this legislation in a way that ensures Australians are safer. Australians want to see unity. They want to see agreement. They want to see the parliament working together, and that’s the approach we’re taking to the sitting. Continue reading...

events.title: Around 1,500 soldiers on standby for deployment to Minneapolis, officials say
events.description: The troops are an option should Donald Trump decide to use them to quell anti-ICE protests in the city, an official tells CBS News.

events.title: Syrian army moves east of Aleppo after Kurdish forces withdraw
events.description: This comes after Syria's government announced its first formal recognition of Kurdish national rights since 1946.

events.title: Machado vows to lead Venezuela 'when right time comes'
events.description: The opposition leader says she has a mandate to lead the country after the US seized its president.

events.title: US-backed Palestinian committee shares mission statement on Gaza governance
events.description: The technocratic body will operate under the direction of Trump's 'board of peace', stacked with pro-Israel figures.

events.title: Military leader Doumbouya sworn in as Guinea’s president
events.description: Doumbouya was declared victor in the West African country's first election since he led the 2021 military takeover.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Trump administration says deporting college student trying to surprise family was a ‘mistake’
events.description: Any Lucía López Belloza was detained at Boston’s airport in November and flown to Honduras two days later US citizens and permanent residents: have you been racially profiled by ICE? The Trump administration apologized in court for a “mistake” in the deportation of a Massachusetts college student who was detained trying to fly home to surprise her family in Texas for Thanksgiving. But the administration still argued that the federal government error should not affect her immigration case. Continue reading...

events.title: CIA chief visits Maduro successor as Machado vows to become Venezuela’s president
events.description: John Ratcliffe meets Delcy Rodríguez in Caracas less than two weeks after his agents helped to oust her precedessor The CIA chief whose agents reputedly played a key role in abducting Nicolás Maduro has flown to Venezuela to meet his successor as the sidelined opposition leader, María Corina Machado, vowed she would become the country’s first elected female president. Machado’s comments were broadcast on Friday, a day after she handed her Nobel peace prize medal to Donald Trump in recognition of what she called a principled and decisive move against Maduro, whom US special forces snatched on 3 January. Continue reading...

events.title: The latest on what's happening in Ukraine
events.description: Many residents in Kyiv are suffering through freezing temperatures with no heat or electricity after Russian strikes on energy infrastructure.

events.title: US: Anti-ICE protesters clash with far-right group in Minneapolis
events.description: Right-wing influencer Jake Lang, who organized a pro-ICE rally, had announced that he intended to "burn a Quran" on the steps of City Hall. A much larger group of people chased him and his supporters off the scene.

events.title: 'The goal is to destroy the Syrian Democratic Forces': Clashes break out between army and Kurds
events.description: Joshua Landis, the director of the University of Oklahoma's Centre for Middle East Studies, talks about how the Syrian military's advance across the country's north aims to end years of autonomy won by the country's Kurdish community – and why the US appears to be abandoning its former allies.

events.title: 'A lot of contradictory information': Syrian and Kurdish forces clash along the Euphrates River
events.description: As the Syrian army and Kurdish-led forces trade accusations of breaking a troop withdrawal agreement in the country's north, FRANCE 24 Damascus correspondent Dana Alboz breaks down how the Syrian military's advance has put part of the region's civilian population to flight.

events.title: Uganda's President Yoweri Museveni wins seventh term as rival Bobi Wine rejects 'fake results'
events.description: Uganda's incumbent President Yoweri Museveni won a seventh term in office, official results showed Saturday, allowing the former guerrilla to extend his four-decade rule of the East African country. His main opponent, Bobi Wine, remains in hiding after security forces raided his home.

events.title: Ugandan long-time president wins election amid opposition claims of 'ballot stuffing'
events.description: Uganda's long-time leader Yoweri Museveni has won the country's presidential election, officials say, amid claims by the main opposition leader of "massive ballot stuffing".

events.title: Illegal migrant workers caught on camera leaping across rooftops to escape Border Patrol in California raid
events.description: Dramatic video captured alleged illegal immigrants fleeing across California rooftops as federal agents conducted an enforcement raid at a construction site.

events.title: National Guard troops will likely remain in DC through 2026, official says
events.description: National Guard troops likely will have their ongoing deployment to Washington, D.C., extended until the end of 2026, a U.S. official told Fox News.

events.title: Illegal alien with 24 convictions among ‘worst of the worst’ arrested in Minnesota ICE operation: DHS
events.description: Federal agents arrested criminal illegal aliens as the DHS blasted Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz for allegedly protecting dangerous offenders through sanctuary policies.

events.title: The border in your backyard: Mexican cartels fuel record fentanyl, meth busts in Rocky Mountain states
events.description: The DEA reported record drug seizures in mountain states after 8.7 million fentanyl pills and 3,100 pounds of methamphetamine were confiscated during 2025 operations.

events.title: Trump tariff threat over Greenland 'unacceptable', European leaders say
events.description: The US president says several European allies opposed to his plans to buy Greenland will face 10% tariffs from February.

events.title: Deadly fire rips through Karachi shopping mall
events.description: Video shows firefighters battling a deadly blaze at a shopping mall in Karachi, Pakistan.

events.title: Guatemala prisoners take workers hostages in riots across three facilities
events.description: Officials say 46 workers are being held, with gang members behind the riots seeking better conditions.

events.title: 'Not for sale': massive protest in Copenhagen against Trump's desire to acquire Greenland
events.description: Thousands of people rallied in Copenhagen to push back on President Trump's rhetoric that the U.S. should acquire Greenland.

events.title: Thousands oppose US plans in 'Hands off Greenland' protests
events.description: Organizers have called on Danish and Greenlandic residents to join marches and rallies against US President Donald Trump's push to acquire Greenland.

events.title: Syrian army enters areas east of Aleppo as Kurds withdraw
events.description: The Syrian army announced that it had taken control of Deir Hafer, a town previously under Kurdish control located east of Aleppo.

events.title: Greenland: Trump announces 10% tariff on Europe – including France, UK, Denmark – starting Feb. 1
events.description: US President Donald Trump on Saturday said he was imposing rising tariffs on eight European countries until the US strikes a deal for the "complete and total purchase" of Greenland, currently an autonomous territory of Denmark.

events.title: Ugandan election a 'fraudulent affair', Bobi Wine's lawyer says - as protesters face violent crackdown
events.description: President Yoweri Museveni has extended his 40-year reign over Uganda by another five years.

events.title: US Congressional delegation seeks to reassure Denmark and Greenland after Trump's threats
events.description: A bipartisan U.S. Congressional delegation is seeking to reassure Denmark and Greenland after President Donald Trump threatened tariffs if nations don’t support a U.S. takeover of Greenland

events.title: Ukraine: Families in ‘survival mode’ amid Russian strikes and deadly cold
events.description: Families across Ukraine are in “constant survival mode” amid ongoing waves of Russian missile and drone strikes that have left blocks without power for days at a time, while temperatures plunge to deadly lows, the UN Children's Fund (UNICEF) said on Friday.

events.title: Cat caught on camera starting dangerous kitchen fire after jumping on stove and turning on burner
events.description: Surveillance video captured the moment a cat turned on a stove burner in Garland, Texas, igniting items and causing extensive kitchen damage to the home.

events.title: Georgian demonstrators watch Iran closely as their own protests grind on
events.description: Georgians display Iranian Lion and Sun flags during daily protests in Tbilisi, showing solidarity with Iranian demonstrators while opposing EU accession halt by their government.

events.title: Iran's ethnic minorities could hold key to regime's fate as protests continue
events.description: Iran's ethnic minorities, comprising nearly 50% of the population, could prove decisive in ongoing anti-regime protests as Kurdish groups lead resistance.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: China reports record trillion-dollar trade surplus despite Trump tariffs
events.description: Results for 2025 risk further unsettling economies about China’s trade practices and overcapacity, and their own over-reliance on Chinese products China has reported a strong export run in 2025 with a record trillion-dollar surplus, as its producers brace for three more years of a Trump administration set on slowing the manufacturing powerhouse by shifting US orders to other markets. Beijing’s resilience to renewed tariff tensions since Donald Trump returned to the US presidency last January has emboldened Chinese firms to shift their focus to south-east Asia, Africa and Latin America to offset US duties. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump says 8 EU countries to be charged 10% tariff for opposing US control of Greenland
events.description: In a post on social media, Trump said a 10% tariff will take effect on Feb. 1, and will climb to 25% on June 1 if a deal is not in place for the United States to purchase Greenland.

events.title: Canada agrees to cut tariff on Chinese EVs in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products
events.description: Breaking with the United States, Canada has agreed to cut its 100% tariff on Chinese electric cars in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Friday.

events.title: US troops pull out of major Iraq airbase amid ongoing regional consolidation effort, progress against ISIS
events.description: The U.S. withdrawal of troops from Ain al-Asad Airbase was completed by Friday as part of regional consolidation following progress on ISIS as CENTCOM calls for "teamwork."

events.title: Trump's pick for Iceland ambassador apologizes for joking about Arctic nation becoming 52nd state
events.description: Former Rep. Billy Long, who was nominated by President Donald Trump to be ambassador to Iceland, apologized after privately joking that the island would become the "52nd state."

events.title: Paracetamol is safe in pregnancy, says study refuting Trump autism claims
events.description: Researchers say their gold-standard review should put an end to the debate over use of the common painkiller during pregnancy.

events.title: Syrian army takes control of Deir Hafer, Maskana under agreement
events.description: Syrian government troops have moved into dozens of towns and villages in eastern Aleppo governorate as the SDF withdraw.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: SA premier ‘fundamentally opposed’ Randa Abdel-Fattah appearing at Adelaide writers’ week, letter to board shows
events.description: Three-page letter acknowledged that while Peter Malinauskas could not direct festival board, he was ‘deeply concerned’ Palestinian Australian author’s invitation not rescinded Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A letter sent by the South Australian premier to the Adelaide writers’ week board criticising the inclusion of Palestinian Australian writer Randa Abdel-Fattah in the 2026 program has been made public. The three-page letter, first published in full by Adelaide’s Sunday Mail newspaper, was signed by Peter Malinauskas and dated 2 January. Continue reading...

events.title: Uganda's election ends with another term for Museveni
events.description: Yoweri Museveni has been declared the winner of the presidential election, extending his rule beyond four decades. Meanwhile, the opposition candidate has reportedly gone into hiding.

events.title: AFCON 2025: Egypt and Nigeria face off for third place
events.description: Egypt and Nigeria will decide third place at the Africa Cup of Nations at the Stade Mohammed V in Casablanca on Saturday. FRANCE 24 Sports Editor Selina Sykes reports from Casablanca.

events.title: Taiwanese reporter accused of bribing military officers to leak information to China
events.description: A journalist in Taiwan has been detained on allegations of bribing army officers to provide military information to people from mainland China, as the self-ruled island cracks down on potential infiltration from China

events.title: Inmates in 3 Guatemalan prisons hold dozens of guards hostage
events.description: Guatemalan authorities are reporting that inmates are holding several dozen prison guards in three prisons

events.title: Syria fighting live: SDF braces for Raqqa assault as gov’t troops march on
events.description: Syria's military says it captured the strategic town of Tabqah from the Kurdish-led SDF during its whirlwind offensive.

events.title: US urges de-escalation as Syrian army advances on Kurdish-held territory
events.description: Kurdish-led SDF accuses Syrian forces of violating withdrawal deal as they take key towns and oilfields.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Syrian government forces enter northern towns after Kurdish fighters withdraw
events.description: Syrian government forces have entered a northern town after Kurdish-led fighters decided to evacuate

events.title: Oregon city reverses vote, removes convicted murderer from police review board after backlash
events.description: Salem City Council reverses controversial decision, removes convicted murderer Kyle Hedquist from police advisory boards after intense public outrage and criticism.

events.title: Nasa's mega Moon rocket arrives at launch pad for Artemis II mission
events.description: Final preparations now get underway for the first crewed mission to the Moon in more than 50 years.

events.title: Ugandan leader extends 40-year rule after winning contested poll
events.description: President Yoweri Museveni wins a seventh term, as his main rival Bobi Wine decries "fake results".

events.title: Avalanches kill five off-piste skiers in Austrian Alps
events.description: A number of people have died in the Alps over the past week, as heavy snowfall has hit the region.

events.title: Japanese mayor apologises after calling staff 'human scum'
events.description: Yokohama mayor Takeharu Yamanaka admits using the terms "idiot" and "human scum" to disparage staff.

events.title: Google appeals landmark antitrust verdict over search monopoly
events.description: The tech giant is seeking a pause on court-ordered fixes aimed at limiting its monopoly power.

events.title: From camouflage to tracksuits - Guinea's junta leader becomes civilian president
events.description: Junta chief Mamadi Doumbouya, set for a seven-year term, has to prove himself as a democratic leader.

events.title: CIA director had two-hour meeting with new Venezuelan leader in Caracas
events.description: The pair discussed economic opportunities and preventing Venezuela becoming a place for "America's adversaries", a US official said.

events.title: China and Canada announce tariffs relief after a high-stakes meeting between Carney and Xi
events.description: Canola oil and electric cars are at the centre of the deal agreed by Mark Carney and Xi Jinping after years of strained ties.

events.title: Myanmar begins defence in landmark genocide case at UN court
events.description: Myanmar says The Gambia has failed to provide enough evidence of genocide against the Muslim-minority people.

events.title: Syrian forces capture Tabqa, nation’s largest dam amid swift push on Raqqa
events.description: Syria’s army accelerates its campaign, securing key infrastructure and forcing Kurdish-led SDF retreat.

events.title: ‘Enormous pain in my heart’: Palestinian evictions mount in East Jerusalem
events.description: Legal appeals by Palestinians who have lived in occupied East Jerusalem for generations were denied in the new year.

events.title: Thousands rally in Serbia as students continue fight against corruption
events.description: University students have proposed banning corrupt officials from politics and investigating their wealth.

events.title: Uganda’s Museveni wins 7th term, opponent calls results ‘fake’
events.description: Uganda’s President Yoweri Museveni has been re-elected to a seventh term, according to official results.

events.title: Nigeria beat Egypt on penalties to claim AFCON bronze medal
events.description: Stanley Nwabali denies Mohamed Salah, saving two penalties as Nigeria beats Egypt for third place at 2025 AFCON.

events.title: What’s pushing Canada and China closer?
events.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney hails his visit to China as 'historic'.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Confidence runs high in London’s Little Morocco as Afcon glory beckons
events.description: Atlas Lions face Senegal in final of Africa Cup of Nations on Sunday and Moroccan diaspora scents victory London’s Little Morocco is brimming with pride and anticipation. The Moroccan diaspora in North Kensington is in no doubt that on Sunday the Atlas Lions will triumph against Senegal in the final of the Africa Cup of Nations. “There’s not just an excitement, it has completely taken over everything else,” said Souad Talsi, who runs the Al-Hasaniya Moroccan women’s centre at the base of 31-storey Trellick Tower, at the north end of Golborne Road. Continue reading...

events.title: Controversial US study on hepatitis B vaccines in Africa is cancelled
events.description: $1.6m project drew outrage over ethical questions about withholding vaccines proven to prevent disease The controversial US-funded study on hepatitis B vaccines among newborns in Guinea-Bissau has been halted, according to Yap Boum, a senior official at the Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). “The study has been cancelled,” Boum told journalists at a press conference on Thursday morning. Continue reading...

events.title: Julio Iglesias denies sexual abuse claims of two former female employees
events.description: Women allege Spanish singer subjected them ‘to inappropriate touching, insults and humiliation … in atmosphere of control’ The Spanish singer Julio Iglesias has broken his silence over allegations that he sexually abused two women who worked in his Caribbean mansions, saying he has never “abused, coerced or disrespected any woman”. The 82-year-old entertainer, whose career spans six decades, had been accused by two female former employees who allege they had been sexually assaulted and subjected “to inappropriate touching, insults and humiliation … in an atmosphere of control and constant harassment”. Continue reading...

events.title: US says it reached deal with Taiwan to lower tariffs and boost investments
events.description: US to lower tariffs on Taiwanese goods to 15% as chip and tech businesses pledge $250bn spending in US operations The US said on Thursday that it had signed a deal with Taiwan to reduce tariffs on goods from the democratic island, while increasing Taiwanese semiconductor and tech companies’ investments in America. The agreement, the US commerce department said, “will drive a massive reshoring of America’s semiconductor sector”. Continue reading...

events.title: ‘I’m back’: Damien Martyn out of hospital after surviving meningitis
events.description: Former Australia batter given a ‘50/50 chance of surviving’ Spent eight days in induced coma Damien Martyn has said he is back after overcoming a meningitis scare, which he said took his life out of his hands. In a heartfelt post on his social media accounts, the former Australia batter said he was given a 50% chance to live after battling the disease, which causes an infection and swelling of fluid and membranes around the brain and spinal cord. The 54-year-old was put into an induced coma on 27 December and was fighting for his life in a Gold Coast intensive care unit until he woke eight days later. Continue reading...

events.title: M 6.0 - 295 km W of Bandon, Oregon
events.description: PAGER - GREEN ShakeMap - I DYFI? - IV Time 2026-01-16 03:25:52 UTC 2026-01-16 03:25:52 UTC at epicenter Location 43.543°N 128.009°W Depth 10.00 km (6.21 mi)

events.title: What a visit to a French clown school reveals about clowning
events.description: A visit to the Gaulier clown school - home to alumni including Sacha Baron Cohen and Emma Thompson - reveals that clowning is all about the art of failure.

events.title: Germany's AfD receives millions in public funding
events.description: The right-wing extremist party Alternative for Germany (AfD) profits significantly from public funding. Is democracy in Germany funding its own downfall?

events.title: Japan: Popular Prime Minister Takaichi calls early election
events.description: Japan's first female leader is popular with voters. She has now called for early elections to leverage their approval. The move could bolster her position, but it carries risks.

events.title: Greenland row: EU weighing response to Trump tariff plan
events.description: European Council President Antonio Costa said the EU was weighing a joint response to a 10% tariff plan announced by President Donald Trump on European nations that oppose his push to acquire Greenland.

events.title: Hungary: Orban gives asylum to EU politicians accused of corruption
events.description: Hungary has just granted asylum to Poland's ex-justice minister, Zbigniew Ziobro, who fled corruption charges at home. The move shows how far Hungary has drifted from the EU, but it's a risky gambit for Viktor Orban.

events.title: Trump to impose tariffs on European nations over Greenland
events.description: Germany, Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, the UK, the Netherlands and Finland to face a 10% tariff beginning February 1. Trump said tariffs will be in place until "a deal is reached" on Greenland.

events.title: Germany news: Merz to host Syrian leader despite criticism
events.description: Syria's interim President Ahmed al-Sharaa's planned visit to Berlin next week has been criticized by Kurdish and Alawite groups in Germany.

events.title: Five graphics that show Greenland’s importance to Trump
events.description: Its entire population would fit in a large sports stadium but Greenland’s current presence on the geopolitical stage is huge. DW takes a look at the reasons it's so coveted — from natural resources to climate change.

events.title: Ethiopia dam: Egypt, Sudan welcome Trump mediation
events.description: The leaders of Egypt and Sudan both welcome US president's offer to mediate in the Nile dam dispute with Ethiopia.

events.title: Elon Musk seeking up to $134 billion from OpenAI, Microsoft
events.description: Musk co-founded OpenAI in 2015 as a nonprofit, but says the company now mainly serves Microsoft's interests. OpenAI has accused Musk of leading a campaign of "harrassment."

events.title: How are ICE agents recruited, and who are they?
events.description: Donald Trump's second presidential term has seen a rapid rise in the number of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents. But who are these people, and where is the US government finding them?

events.title: AFCON 2025: Nigeria claim third place as Senegal file complaint
events.description: The Super Eagles have finished in third place for the ninth time beating Egypt on penalties after neither side managed to break the deadlock. Meanwhile, as they gear up for the final, Senegal filed a complaint following the reception of their squad in Rabat. Will it be one for Morocco to loose, as they attempt to lift the trophy for the first time in 50 years?

events.title: AFCON 2025: Morocco and Senegal prepare for final showdown
events.description: Hosts Morocco and Senegal will fight it out in a heavyweight Africa Cup of Nations final this weekend after tense last-four victories on Wednesday. The tournament has delivered a final showdown for the trophy between Africa's two modern footballing powerhouses, the continent's best sides according to the FIFA rankings.

events.title: Canada announces trade deal with China on EVs, canola
events.description: Canada and China struck an initial trade deal on Friday that will slash tariffs on electric vehicles and ⁠canola, as both nations promised to tear down trade barriers while forging new strategic ties during Prime Minister Mark Carney's visit. FRANCE 24 speaks to Jean-Baptiste Monnier, Asia Centre Vice President, to shed more light on the implications of the trade agreement.

events.title: Trump is not bluffing, Greenland situation is critical for the EU and NATO
events.description: "The situation is critical…" Those are the four words a top European diplomat chose when we discussed Donald Trump's position on Greenland.

events.title: Iraq veterans living with 'ticking time bomb'
events.description: British soldiers say they were not offered biological screening after being exposed to a deadly toxin in Iraq 20 years ago - despite official guidance they should have been, Sky News can reveal.

events.title: Sir Tony Blair 'honoured' to be part of Trump's efforts to rebuild Gaza
events.description: Sir Tony Blair has said he is "honoured" to be appointed as part of a team that will be key to Donald Trump's plan to rebuild Gaza.

events.title: Gaza's four layers of governance - and where Sir Tony Blair fits in
events.description: Like so much of the politics in the Middle East, the new governance structure for Gaza is complicated and contentious.

events.title: Portugal's presidential election may deliver another gain for populists in Europe
events.description: Portugal's presidential election features a record 11 candidates, with a populist party leader poised for a potential breakthrough

events.title: Thousands rally in Serbia as students vow to lead on fight against corruption
events.description: Thousands of people have rallied in Serbia as university students announced a new stage in their struggle against President Aleksandar Vucic’s government after leading more than a year of mass demonstrations that shook his autocratic rule in the Balkan...

events.title: Iraqi army fully takes over key base following US withdrawal
events.description: All U.S. forces have left the base and removed all American equipment from it.

events.title: Sri Lanka unveils a rare purple star sapphire claimed to be the biggest of its kind
events.description: A massive purple star sapphire weighing 3,563 carats has been unveiled in Sri Lanka

events.title: Horses leap through flames and pets go to church in Spanish rituals honoring saint
events.description: Hundreds of people in Spain have watched horses gallop through flames as part of the centuries-old tradition called Las Luminarias

events.title: Egypt and Sudan welcome Trump's offer to mediate Nile River dam dispute
events.description: Egypt and Sudan welcome President Trump's offer to resume U.S. mediation with Ethiopia over the Nile River water dispute

events.title: British police force chief behind decision to ban Maccabi fans from Aston Villa match retires
events.description: A British police force chief has retired following criticism over a decision to ban Maccabi Tel Aviv fans from a match against Aston Villa last year

events.title: FBI captures Top Ten Most Wanted fugitive sought for alleged 2016 murder of North Carolina co-worker in Mexico
events.description: FBI Director Kash Patel announced the arrest of a wanted fugitive who has been on the run after the alleged murder of his former co-worker in 2016.

events.title: Former TV anchor accused of killing her mother ruled incompetent, murder case put on hold
events.description: Former TV news anchor accused of killing her mother ruled mentally incompetent for trial. Angelynn Mock allegedly stabbed 80-year-old mother on Halloween.

events.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Virginia nanny's story, dentist murders charges, Barry Morphew's plea
events.description: Stay up to date with the Fox News True Crime Newsletter, which brings you the latest cases ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.

events.title: Woman wakes up with 8-foot python coiled on her chest while sleeping: 'Don't move'
events.description: A Brisbane woman calmly removed an 8-foot carpet python from her bedroom after waking to find the non-venomous snake on top of her chest Monday night.

events.title: NATO ambassador says Europe 'has a tendency to overreact' over Greenland dispute
events.description: U.S. NATO ambassador Matthew Whitaker defends American focus on Greenland amid European backlash, calling Arctic security crucial for continental defense.

events.title: Australia removes 4.7M kids from social media platforms in first month of historic ban
events.description: Australia says millions of underage social media accounts were shut down in the first month after a sweeping new ban on users under 16 took effect.
